subject: RE: re : Re: [junit] Embedding multiple Tests into a loop...
msgSnippet: I don t think your approach is foolish. I think JUnit ought to be smart enough to allow an option to continue-on-failure. ...
messageBody:
RE: re : Re: [junit] Embedding multiple Tests into a loop...

I don't think your approach is foolish. I think JUnit ought to be smart enough to allow an option to continue-on-failure.

    -----Original Message-----
    From:   tsmets@... [SMTP:tsmets@...]
    Sent:   Monday, March 12, 2001 9:19 AM
    To:     joi@...; junit@yahoogroups.com
    Subject:        re : Re: [junit] Embedding multiple Tests into a loop...


    Sounds the best option
    I'm just not acquainted to making suite & old FORTRAN taught me to use vector or arrays like no other :-))
    Hence my foolish approach
    Tx,

    Thomas,


    <snip>
    There was a thread with a similar theme a few weeks ago.  I think its
    conclusion was that you should extend TestCase to accept a single filename
    and run a single test object per filename.  Create a suite object
    which accepts the String Array and loops creating tests instead
    of the Test looping within itself.
    </snip>
